ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To detect and analyze anti-bot systems, CAPTCHAs, and browser fingerprinting techniques in real-time for security research and web development.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time detection of CAPTCHAs, anti-bot systems, and fingerprinting techniques â€¢ Multi-layer detection system including DOM analysis, network monitoring, payload analysis, JavaScript hooks, and window property checks
ðŸ“– Summary: The Scrapfly Anti-bot Detector is a Manifest V3 Chrome extension designed to identify and analyze various anti-bot systems, CAPTCHAs, and browser fingerprinting techniques in real-time. It provides detailed insights, confidence scores, and advanced capture tools for security researchers and web developers.

âœ¨ chirp | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To demonstrate and enable the transmission and reception of text-based data using audible sound waves, primarily for educational or proof-of-concept purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time frequency visualization of audio input â€¢ Send messages by converting text to sound â€¢ Receive messages by listening to sound and decoding it back to text â€¢ Distinctive start and end signatures to mark transmissions
ðŸ“– Summary: Chirp is a TypeScript application that enables data transfer through sound. It encodes text into audio frequencies for transmission via speakers and decodes received audio back into text, featuring real-time frequency visualization.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ serviceradar | Elixir
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Network management and observability for distributed systems, especially in constrained or hard-to-reach environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time Monitoring â€¢ Distributed Architecture â€¢ SRQL (ServiceRadar Query Language) â€¢ Unified Data Layer (CloudNativePG, TimescaleDB, Apache AGE) â€¢ Observability (OTEL, GELF, Syslog, SNMP, NetFlow, RPerf, BGP, gNMI)
ðŸ“– Summary: ServiceRadar is a distributed network monitoring system designed for infrastructure and services in constrained or hard-to-reach environments. It offers real-time monitoring, distributed architecture, and cloud-based alerting, supporting various data collection methods like metrics, logs, traces, and SNMP.

ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide developers with a pre-configured, robust starting point for building new React web applications quickly and efficiently.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ React starter kit â€¢ Opinionated foundation â€¢ Production-ready â€¢ Modern web applications â€¢ Curated tools and patterns
ðŸ“– Summary: Base Stack is an opinionated React starter kit designed to provide a production-ready foundation for building modern web applications. It offers a curated set of tools and patterns to accelerate development and ensure a seamless developer experience.

ðŸš€ superseedr | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A terminal-based BitTorrent client with advanced swarm analytics and secure Docker integration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Animated, high-performance TUI (1â€“60 FPS) â€¢ OS-level magnet link support â€¢ Real-time network graphs and swarm analytics â€¢ Official Docker + VPN setup with automatic port forwarding â€¢ Dynamic inbound port reloading without restarting the client
ðŸ“– Summary: Superseedr is a terminal-based BitTorrent client written in Rust, offering a high-performance TUI for real-time swarm observability, secure Docker integration with VPN support, and automatic network configuration. It prioritizes speed, privacy, and reliability for desktop and server use.
